text: [Chapter 26a] [Sector 5, Shadow Realm Research Center]
Proton...
I've heard much about you, and you've caused us a lot of trouble...
I don't understand though, why would you return here after all of these years?
We can't let you have the Holy Itucher, you'll surely destroy the world as we know it.
And this is revenge for what you've done to Specians and the Xuirs.
What I've done to the Xuirs?
The only thing I've done for the Xuirs is help them.
What do you mean?
The Proto-Xuirs are a pained existence, an incomplete and failed life form.
The Proto-Xuirs will only be free once a complete Xuir is created, the lifeform that they were meant to be!
Being incomplete doensn't devalue your existence. This is just an excuse to justify your actions.
It doesn't? Well, take a look at this...
What do you think of this, Proton?
You're... a Proto-Xuir?
Why do you think I've dedicated myself to the Xuir Research?
I am an incomplete creation of the past researchers, an existence of failure.
This existence is pain. Proton, surely you've considered the fact that you were the result of unsuccessful experiements, that your very existence is a literal embodiment of failure.
I wish to fix this failure, no matter the cost.
I will create the being that were supposed to be, the one that we could've been...
And only then, will be free from our burden of an failed existence and be able to die in the peace of knowing that our failure had been fixed.
We must fix our existence, Proton.
Sadly, it seems you do not understand.
Like the others, all who oppose me must be defeated in the sake of mending our existence.
Why... why.. must this happen...
The Xuir... must be... completed...
Everyone, search the area.
The Holy Itucher should be somewhere around here.
[Chapter 27a] [Sector 5, Shadow Realm Research Center]
